pullRequest.body:
and prove that these contain (commutative) `(Add)NormedGroup`s. This allows generalising results from normed spaces/normed groups to `ENNReal` also.

A future PR will generalise lemmas in mathlib to use these new classes. This PR only changes a few lemmas, to prove that these definitions are set up right.

From the Carleson project.

---------

Re-done version of #21422.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +12.72% | `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic | 1014 | 1143 | +129 (+12.72%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>5 files</summary> `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Log.ERealExp` `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Chebyshev` `Mathlib.Data.Complex.Exponential` `Mathlib.Data.Complex.Norm` `Mathlib.Data.Complex.Trigonometric`</details>|4|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Rat`|14|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.AddTorsor`|24|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.MulAction`|26|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.DirichletCharacter.Bounds`|46|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Gershgorin`|47|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Polynomial.CauchyBound` `Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.CauSeqFilter`|51|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Asymptotics.Defs` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Basic`|52|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Int`|114|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.CocompactMap`|118|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Submodule`|120|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Subgroup`|126|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Constructions` `Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.MStructure`|128|
|<details><summary>5 files</summary> `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Order.Hom.Basic` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Order.Hom.Ultra` `Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.IndicatorFunction` `Mathlib.InformationTheory.Hamming`</details>|129|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Continuous.enorm`
`+ ContinuousAt.enorm`
`+ ContinuousENorm`
`+ ENormedAddCommMonoid`
`+ ENormedAddMonoid`
`+ ENormedCommMonoid`
`+ ENormedMonoid`
`+ Inseparable.enorm_eq_enorm'`
`+ NormedCommGroup.toENormedCommMonoid`
`+ NormedGroup.toENormedMonoid`
`+ SeminormedGroup.toContinuousENorm`
`+ continuous_enorm`
`- Continuous.enorm'`
`- ContinuousAt.enorm'`
`- continuous_enorm'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
This import increase is needed to speak of a topological space structure on `ENNReal`.
The only way I see to avoid this is to move these definitions to `Continuity.lean`.

Yael pointed out that this import was already added back in #20966 (for the same reason), and only removed in #21554 (which split that file). Hence, I would argue that keeping ENNReal out of `Basic.lean` only worked in the short-term, and this import is really needed.

pullRequest.title: feat: add classes `ContinuousENorm` and `ENormed(Add)(Comm)Monoid`
